attributes.action: Introduce a law mandating that all "direct marketing" be opt-in
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Every day British citizens receive intrusive and unwanted phone calls, email, and postal mail from thousands of different companies conducting "direct marketing". The existence of industry codes of practice which support voluntary "opt-out" schemes has failed to halt this deluge. This petition calls on the prime minister to introduce a law mandating that all forms of "direct marketing" be conducted only on those who sign up for a government maintained "opt-in" list. It will therefore become a criminal offence for companies to conduct direct marketing campaigns against citizens who have not "opted-in" to receive such communications and who they do not have an existing business relationship with.
